page.title: 01FARMING
page.content: Principally the area is an urban area.However the city has a long tradition as a market and service centre for agriculture. The area of study is situated to the east of the city.A large amount of potential agricultural land has been clear for industrial use.A substantial amount of land is waste or in marginal use, e.g.as a scrap yard. As one moves east the river valley merges into the Fens.Here begins serious attempts of large scale farming. Flag fen and Northey are areas of arable farming.Here large fields,often over 10 acres,grow crops such as wheat,barley and potatoes. Despite 5 road signs warning of animals few were seen.Nearer the city centre there were 7 ponies being grazed.
